text: hey team! Jenna is ooo and i am wfh/fto this am - please go ahead and meet for stand up without us if that's preferred - otherwise feel free to provide your updates over slack!
and let me know if there's anything I can help move forward for you - otherwise I'll see you around noon :)

Sounds good.
I’m working through the accessibility list today. With that, I’ll put together the screens for Melissa to take a look at today. I’ll also work through dialogs and some other tickets.
awesome! thank you!
i killed my laptop
and am not used to my tablet keyboard yet
I'm back in the office today. I'm working on updating the CMS with the modal helper images, etc, today.
cool cool.
welcome back John! and excited to see those updates!
Morning! I’ll be working through some of the JIRA tickets that jenna created late last week.
perfect! just let me know if you need anything as you work through those :)

<@U0U9WJB7F> i’m creating some JIRA tickets for UX improvements and assigning them to you, only because i’ll leave it to you and lynsey to determine priority for future stuff. I just dont want to lose track of any of the things we chatted about on Friday.
i’m giving them all the label “ux_improvement”

I'm excited to see those in place. hindi looks so beautiful

<@U2H61EJSG> where are you
this add cases/known cases screen is FUCKING DOPE
that is all
Hooray! Btw <@U026PHQ3J>, what’s the status on the account auth piece?
still broken AFAIK
whats a good earth code to enter to see this in action for earth?
There are 3: 5433, 5483, and 5653
thx

note to self/<@U0260V1BX> on case pairing screen - we should provide some way for users to get out of this screen (outside of back button) + also believe text should scroll off screen vs. being sticky (as currently implemented)
i can create tickets after i get out of this meeting
Re: accessibility review - I decided to remove clickability on settings (the view, not the toggle) that have toggle switches, because it’s confusing in accessibility. Talked it over with <@U0260V1BX>
Didn’t change this in Legacy because there are some weird things going on with listeners in Places, that I’m unsure about messing around with/didn’t want to prioritize right now

<@U0260V1BX> and/or <@U0XJFPSRL> I have a UX question for whoever has a spare moment: I’m reworking onboarding so that the user doesn’t see the ‘Enter Code’ screen after entering a valid code if they push the system back button. This works great when pairing the first case, but not so well when the user goes to pair a second case. When adding a second case with this new re-work in place, pushing the back button after entering a code brings the user to the main live case settings screen. However, because they haven’t finished the onboarding process for their new case selecting ‘Add a new case’ again will show the ‘Pair success’ screen for the code they last entered.

This might be very confusing for a user that was expecting to see the ‘Add a case’ screen instead of the ‘Pair success’ screen therefore my question is - what should happen when a user pushes the back button after entering a code for a second case and how should we handle users who abandon onboarding at this stage?
Let me know if you would like for me to show you this in person as I’m sure my description of the issue is very confusing!

One thing I’d like to explore is allowing the “your cases” screen to be a jumping off point to revisit onboarding for any case. In the meantime, I think that the scenario you’ve outlined is a fairly uncommon one and in the case that I abandoned onboarding and then went back to add a new case, the pairing success screen probably IS what I should see. I think it may depend on how much time has passed since the last code was paired. If it’s the same day or within a few days, we might guess that the user is trying to add the same case. If it’s a month later we might want to kick them back to the “Your Cases” screen.
I’m not totally convinced that the “Your Cases” screen is what the user should see when they tap “Add a New Case” anyway, but that is an exploration for another day :slightly_smiling_face:

Agreed! I think for now I will keep the flow as it is (showing the ‘pair success’ screen if the user hasn’t completed onboarding) until we have a chance to further explore the ‘Your cases’ screen. Thanks for the feedback!
<!here|@here> does anyone remember/know where that Your Cases screen came from? was that an ustwo design?
It’s in the running deck (slide 6): <https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1pvYQ4nec8o3zep2R0s4CNwSFjehYojBT-2wX3ayLhaM/edit#slide=id.g220f3c3b47_0_31>

I remember we had a more robust design of this proposed to address gifting. Seems that gifting fell off our radar at some point <https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1PewT2wBgFpkdXZmiWEwbeI7lTN0Mz4uey8k_SbYYDzY/edit#slide=id.g1c888ae15e_0_28>
